Sequence Information.Peptide Name: MBD-4 (MBD4, mouse beta defensin 4, or Defb4, UCSS1a; natural AMPs; rodents, mammals, animals; 3S=S)
Sequence Information.Source: tongue, esophagus, and trachea; house mouse,Mus musculus

Literature Information.Literature: Orthologue of hBD-2. Located on chromosome 8. mRNA detected in several tissues (see Source). Three disulfide bonds are C9-C37, C16-C30, and C20-C38. When expressed as a fusion protein, mBD-4 showed activity against both E. coli (MIC 1 ug/ml) and S. aureus (MIC 1 ug/ml) as well as chemotactic activity via CCR6-expressing cells (Rohrl J et al. J Biol Chem. 2010 Mar 5;285(10):7028-34). Updated 3/2014; 3/2017; 6/2023.
Literature Information.Author: Jia HP, Wowk SA, Schutte BC, Lee SK, Vivado A, Tack BF, Bevins CL, McCray PB Jr.2000
Literature Information.Title: A novel murine beta -defensin expressed in tongue, esophagus, and trachea
